trans-unit.source: Create an Azure SQL Database with C#
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure SQL Database with C#

trans-unit.source: This article shows you how to create an Azure SQL Database with C# using the the Azure SQL Database Library for .NET.
trans-unit.target: This article shows you how to create an Azure SQL Database with C# using the the Azure SQL Database Library for .NET.

trans-unit.source: Create a SQL Database with C#
trans-unit.target: Create a SQL Database with C#

trans-unit.source: Single database
trans-unit.target: Single database

trans-unit.source: This article provides commands to create an Azure SQL database with C# using the <link><linkText>Azure SQL Database Library for .NET</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: This article provides commands to create an Azure SQL database with C# using the <link><linkText>Azure SQL Database Library for .NET</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: This article shows how to create a single database, for creating elastic databases see <link><linkText>Create an Elastic database pool</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: This article shows how to create a single database, for creating elastic databases see <link><linkText>Create an Elastic database pool</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Individual code snippets are broken out for clarity and a sample console application brings all the commands together in the section at the bottom of this article.
trans-unit.target: Individual code snippets are broken out for clarity and a sample console application brings all the commands together in the section at the bottom of this article.

trans-unit.source: The Azure SQL Database Library for .NET provides an <link><linkText>Azure Resource Manager</linkText><title></title></link>-based API that wraps the <link><linkText>Resource Manager-based SQL Database REST API</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The Azure SQL Database Library for .NET provides an <link><linkText>Azure Resource Manager</linkText><title></title></link>-based API that wraps the <link><linkText>Resource Manager-based SQL Database REST API</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: This client library follows the common pattern for Resource Manager-based client libraries.
trans-unit.target: This client library follows the common pattern for Resource Manager-based client libraries.

trans-unit.source: Resource Manager requires resource groups, and authenticating with <link><linkText>Azure Active Directory</linkText><title></title></link> (AAD).
trans-unit.target: Resource Manager requires resource groups, and authenticating with <link><linkText>Azure Active Directory</linkText><title></title></link> (AAD).

trans-unit.source: The SQL Database Library for .NET is currently in preview.
trans-unit.target: The SQL Database Library for .NET is currently in preview.

trans-unit.source: To complete the steps in this article you need the following:
trans-unit.target: To complete the steps in this article you need the following:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: If you need an Azure subscription simply click FREE TRIAL at the top of this page, and then come back to finish this article.
trans-unit.target: If you need an Azure subscription simply click FREE TRIAL at the top of this page, and then come back to finish this article.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: For a free copy of Visual Studio, see the <link><linkText>Visual Studio Downloads</linkText><title></title></link> page.
trans-unit.target: For a free copy of Visual Studio, see the <link><linkText>Visual Studio Downloads</linkText><title></title></link> page.

trans-unit.source: Installing the required libraries
trans-unit.target: Installing the required libraries

trans-unit.source: Get the required management libraries by installing the following packages using the <link><linkText>package manager console</linkText><title></title></link>:
trans-unit.target: Get the required management libraries by installing the following packages using the <link><linkText>package manager console</linkText><title></title></link>:

trans-unit.source: Configure authentication with Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Configure authentication with Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: You must first enable your client application to access the REST API by setting up the required authentication.
trans-unit.target: You must first enable your client application to access the REST API by setting up the required authentication.

trans-unit.source: The <link><linkText>Azure Resource Manager REST APIs</linkText><title></title></link> use Azure Active Directory for authentication.
trans-unit.target: The <link><linkText>Azure Resource Manager REST APIs</linkText><title></title></link> use Azure Active Directory for authentication.

trans-unit.source: To authenticate your client application based on the current user you must first register your application in the AAD domain associated with the subscription under which the Azure resources have been created.
trans-unit.target: To authenticate your client application based on the current user you must first register your application in the AAD domain associated with the subscription under which the Azure resources have been created.

trans-unit.source: If your Azure subscription was created with a Microsoft account rather than a work or school account you will already have a default AAD domain.
trans-unit.target: If your Azure subscription was created with a Microsoft account rather than a work or school account you will already have a default AAD domain.

trans-unit.source: Registering the application can be done in the <link><linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Registering the application can be done in the <link><linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To create a new application and register it in the correct active directory do the following:
trans-unit.target: To create a new application and register it in the correct active directory do the following:

trans-unit.source: Scroll the menu on the left side to locate the Active Directory service and open it.
trans-unit.target: Scroll the menu on the left side to locate the Active Directory service and open it.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>AAD</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>AAD</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select the directory to authenticate your application and click it's Name.
trans-unit.target: Select the directory to authenticate your application and click it's Name.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Directories</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Directories</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the directory page, click APPLICATIONS.
trans-unit.target: On the directory page, click APPLICATIONS.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click ADD to create a new application.
trans-unit.target: Click ADD to create a new application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Add an application my organization is developing.
trans-unit.target: Select Add an application my organization is developing.

trans-unit.source: Provide a NAME for the app, and select NATIVE CLIENT APPLICATION.
trans-unit.target: Provide a NAME for the app, and select NATIVE CLIENT APPLICATION.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Provide a REDIRECT URI.
trans-unit.target: Provide a REDIRECT URI.

trans-unit.source: It doesn't need to be an actual endpoint, just a valid URI.
trans-unit.target: It doesn't need to be an actual endpoint, just a valid URI.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Finish creating the app, click CONFIGURE, and copy the CLIENT ID (you will need the client id in your code).
trans-unit.target: Finish creating the app, click CONFIGURE, and copy the CLIENT ID (you will need the client id in your code).

trans-unit.source: <linkText>get client id</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>get client id</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the bottom of the page click on Add application.
trans-unit.target: On the bottom of the page click on Add application.

trans-unit.source: Select Microsoft Apps.
trans-unit.target: Select Microsoft Apps.

trans-unit.source: Select Azure Service Management API, and then complete the wizard.
trans-unit.target: Select Azure Service Management API, and then complete the wizard.

trans-unit.source: With the API selected you now need to grant the specific permissions required to access this API by selecting Access Azure Service Management (preview).
trans-unit.target: With the API selected you now need to grant the specific permissions required to access this API by selecting Access Azure Service Management (preview).

trans-unit.source: <linkText>permissions</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>permissions</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click SAVE.
trans-unit.target: Click SAVE.

trans-unit.source: Identify the domain name
trans-unit.target: Identify the domain name

trans-unit.source: The domain name is required for your code.
trans-unit.target: The domain name is required for your code.

trans-unit.source: An easy way to identify the proper domain name is to:
trans-unit.target: An easy way to identify the proper domain name is to:

trans-unit.source: Go to the <link><linkText>Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Go to the <link><linkText>Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Hover over your name in the upper right corner and note the Domain that appears in the pop-up window.
trans-unit.target: Hover over your name in the upper right corner and note the Domain that appears in the pop-up window.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Identify domain name</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Identify domain name</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Additional AAD Resources
trans-unit.target: Additional AAD Resources

trans-unit.source: Additional information about using Azure Active Directory for authentication can be found in <link><linkText>this useful blog post</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Additional information about using Azure Active Directory for authentication can be found in <link><linkText>this useful blog post</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Retrieve the access token for the current user
trans-unit.target: Retrieve the access token for the current user

trans-unit.source: The client application must retrieve the application access token for the current user.
trans-unit.target: The client application must retrieve the application access token for the current user.

trans-unit.source: The first time this code is executed by a user they will be prompted to enter their user credentials and the resulting token is cached locally.
trans-unit.target: The first time this code is executed by a user they will be prompted to enter their user credentials and the resulting token is cached locally.

trans-unit.source: Subsequent executions will retrieve the token from the cache and will only prompt the user to log in if the token has expired.
trans-unit.target: Subsequent executions will retrieve the token from the cache and will only prompt the user to log in if the token has expired.

trans-unit.source: The examples in this article use a synchronous form of each API request and block until completion of the REST call on the underlying service.
trans-unit.target: The examples in this article use a synchronous form of each API request and block until completion of the REST call on the underlying service.

trans-unit.source: There are async methods available.
trans-unit.target: There are async methods available.

trans-unit.source: Create a resource group
trans-unit.target: Create a resource group

trans-unit.source: With Resource Manager, all resources must be created in a resource group.
trans-unit.target: With Resource Manager, all resources must be created in a resource group.

trans-unit.source: A resource group is a container that holds related resources for an application.
trans-unit.target: A resource group is a container that holds related resources for an application.

trans-unit.source: With Azure SQL Database the database server must be created within an existing resource group and then the database created on the server.
trans-unit.target: With Azure SQL Database the database server must be created within an existing resource group and then the database created on the server.

trans-unit.source: Then before an application can connect to the server or database you must also create a firewall rule on the server to open access from the client IP address.
trans-unit.target: Then before an application can connect to the server or database you must also create a firewall rule on the server to open access from the client IP address.

trans-unit.source: Create a server
trans-unit.target: Create a server

trans-unit.source: SQL databases are contained in servers.
trans-unit.target: SQL databases are contained in servers.

trans-unit.source: The server name must be globally unique among all Azure SQL servers so you will get an error here if the server name is already taken.
trans-unit.target: The server name must be globally unique among all Azure SQL servers so you will get an error here if the server name is already taken.

trans-unit.source: Also worth noting is that this command may take several minutes to complete.
trans-unit.target: Also worth noting is that this command may take several minutes to complete.

trans-unit.source: Create a server firewall rule to allow access to the server
trans-unit.target: Create a server firewall rule to allow access to the server

trans-unit.source: By default a server cannot be connected to from any location.
trans-unit.target: By default a server cannot be connected to from any location.

trans-unit.source: In order to connect to a server or any databases on the server, a <link><linkText>firewall rule</linkText><title></title></link> must be defined that allows access from the client IP address.
trans-unit.target: In order to connect to a server or any databases on the server, a <link><linkText>firewall rule</linkText><title></title></link> must be defined that allows access from the client IP address.

trans-unit.source: The following example creates a rule that opens access to the server from any IP address.
trans-unit.target: The following example creates a rule that opens access to the server from any IP address.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that you create appropriate SQL logins and passwords to secure your database and not rely on firewall rules as a primary defense against intrusion.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that you create appropriate SQL logins and passwords to secure your database and not rely on firewall rules as a primary defense against intrusion.

trans-unit.source: To allow other Azure services to access a server add a firewall rule and set both the StartIpAddress and EndIpAddress to 0.0.0.0.
trans-unit.target: To allow other Azure services to access a server add a firewall rule and set both the StartIpAddress and EndIpAddress to 0.0.0.0.

trans-unit.source: Note that this allows Azure traffic from any Azure subscription to access the server.
trans-unit.target: Note that this allows Azure traffic from any Azure subscription to access the server.

trans-unit.source: Create a database
trans-unit.target: Create a database

trans-unit.source: The following command will create a new Basic database if a database with the same name does not exist on the server; if a database with the same name does exist it will be updated.
trans-unit.target: The following command will create a new Basic database if a database with the same name does not exist on the server; if a database with the same name does exist it will be updated.
